abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the State of Bahia -
            Salvador Metropolitan Development Project for Brazil were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory, project sustainability
            was likely, Bank performance was satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons learned
            included: the modus operandi of Salvador Metropolitan
            Development Agency (CONDER) in developing partnerships is
            worth highlighting. It was apparently, effective in inter
            agency communications as well as informal consultation and
            participation, and selling itself with credibility through
            the delivery of promises made to the community, was a very
            important ingredient for success. Staff continuity in CONDER
            throughout the life of the project was very important. The
            other important lesson is the way the State created an
            enabling environment for the private sector. Both in the
            historic center as well as in the various rehabilitation of
            urban park, the state provided the public infrastructure,
            and invited the private sector to invest in construction, or
            alternatively in leasing and operating a number of
            facilities (food, recreation, etc.).
